text: The Second defenestration of Prague happened on 23 May 1618, during the Bohemian Revolt. Jaroslav Bořita of Martinice, Vilém Slavata of Chlum and Filip Fabricius were thrown out of a window of Prague Castle. That marked the beginning of the Thirty Years' War and was a turning point in the history of Europe. == Related pages == * First defenestration of Prague, in 1419, at the start of the Hussite Wars Category:17th century in Europe Category:1618 Category:History of the Czech Republic
title: Second defenestration of Prague
